SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.views.validation

Annotation Interface CompatibleUnionColumns

@Documented @Constraint(validatedBy=CompatibleUnionColumnsValidator.class) @Target(FIELD) @Retention(RUNTIME) public @interface CompatibleUnionColumns
Validation constraint that ensures all elements in unionAll lists have compatible columns.

This constraint is used to validate that when multiple SelectClause objects are combined in a union operation, they all have compatible column structures. Compatibility requires:

  • The same number of columns in each element
  • Compatible data types for corresponding columns
  • Matching collection indicators (whether a column represents a collection or a single value)

When applied to a field of type List<SelectClause>, this constraint ensures that all elements can be safely combined in a SQL UNION ALL operation without type conflicts.

The validation is performed by CompatibleUnionColumnsValidator, which compares the first element's columns with all other elements in the list.

See Also:
  • CompatibleUnionColumnsValidator

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    Class<?>[]
    groups
    The validation groups this constraint belongs to.
    String
    message
    Error message template to use when the validation fails.
    Class<? extends jakarta.validation.Payload>[]
    payload
    Payload that can be attached to a constraint declaration.

  • Element Details

    • message

      String message
      Error message template to use when the validation fails.

      The default message is overridden by the validator with a more specific message that includes details about which element is incompatible and why.

      Returns:
      the error message template
      Default:
      "All elements in unionAll must have compatible columns"

    • groups

      Class<?>[] groups
      The validation groups this constraint belongs to.
      Returns:
      the validation groups
      Default:
      {}

    • payload

      Class<? extends jakarta.validation.Payload>[] payload
      Payload that can be attached to a constraint declaration.
      Returns:
      the payload
      Default:
      {}
